DOC.brief_title: Single Injection Adductor Canal Block Versus Continuous Adductor Canal Infusion Total Knee Arthroplasty
DOC.detailed_description: The objective study determine single shot multimodal peripheral nerve block contain bupivacaine , dexamethasone , buprenorphine , clonidine , epinephrine provide comparable ( non-inferior ) analgesic control compare adductor catheter . The primary end point pain score 30 hour post block initiation . Secondary end point include , opioid consumption , time first analgesic request ; pain score ; blood glucose level patient whose treatment prescribe include routine blood glucose management ; binary patient satisfaction ( yes/no ) ; likeliness recommend analgesic regimen , straight leg raise test post-operative day ( POD ) number 1 ; adverse event , incidence post-operative nausea , vomit . Methods Measures Design The study randomize , double-blind , sham catheter study . Patients recruit randomized one two group : The `` Treatment Arm '' receive single shot adductor canal block contain 20 milliliter ( ml ) solution include 0.25 % bupivacaine , 150 mcg buprenorphine , 2 mg dexamethasone , 1.67 mcg/ml clonidine , 1:400,000 epinephrine sham catheter . The sham catheter place Sartorius muscle sterile , aseptic fashion patient 's control arm . The pump set low possible volume per hour normal saline ( 0.1 ml/hour current pump use hospital ) . An opaque bag place pump blinding purpose . The `` Control Arm '' receive adductor canal catheter receive 20 ml bolus 0.25 % bupivacaine 1:400,000 epinephrine follow adductor canal catheter infusion 0.125 % bupivacaine 10 ml/hour . An opaque bag place control arm pump similar fashion . For patient , order electronic medical record per research pharmacy protocol . For primary anesthetic , patient arm receive either subarachnoid ( spinal ) anesthetic general anesthetic per anesthesiologist operating room .
DOC.criteria: Patients eligible inclusion study : Age 18 year old old Scheduled primary unilateral total knee arthroplasty . Patients must give write informed consent anesthesia include continuous adductor canal block postoperative analgesia prior recruitment Patients exclude : A contraindication adductor canal block catheter placement include , limited site infection , irritation , refusal . Poorly control diabetes ( A1C > 8.0 ) Allergy medication involve study ( opioids , bupivacaine , buprenorphine , clonidine , dexamethasone ) Opioid use > 40 mg oxycodone daily , longacting opioids .
